runs.comm: back of a length on the leg stump which Simmons tries to get away. Ends up being called a leg-bye
defends this slightly shortish length to the leg side off the back foot
pitches this way up just outside off as Simmons was stuck on the back foot trying to manufacture a shot out of it
delivers a yorker on middle which is hit back to the bowler
back of a length slightly shaping in as Simmons defends off the back foot
drives this one straight to short cover as McClenaghan's fine over comes to an end
starts off with a 141 kph loosener which Charles is late on as he has a general waft at it towards extra-cover
142 kph, drops this a bit shorter as Charles is unable to get bat on ball. Wasn't quite sure what to do with that one
121 kph, tries a slower ball which Charles sees early as he is given room outside off to cut this away behind point for a boundary, beating third man to the rope
plays this fuller ball towards the off side, but can't pinch a run
back of a length on the thigh pad which Charles is late on as the ball goes to the off side
131 kph, back of a length and played to short fine leg as Simmons tries in vain to get this away
fuller one just outside off which is lofted straight down the ground for a boundary
going down the leg side as Simmons helps this along to the fine leg boundary for four
spears one in on middle and off as Simmons is able to get this away to the off side
length on middle which is driven down to mid-off, who makes a fine diving stop
goes up and over to this fuller one just outside off as third man comes into play
fullish delivery on off which is driven straight to short cover
144 kph, a little shorter as Charles plays the short-arm pull to mid-on
fires in a bouncer which Charles top-edges straight up in the air, with the ball carrying behind, but not close enough for Ronchi, running backwards, to be able to get it
Simmons able to get a fortuitous boundary with an outside edge which beats the slip fielder to the right of him
back of a length which is pulled to the leg side for a single

Milne rushes onto Charles as he goes for a pull shot. Seemed in control but then realises quickly that the ball is dying just before the square boundary. And it is that man, Guptill, who ends up taking a good catch just before the rope. Milne gets his first, and New Zealand on their way
no mucking around from Simmons as he just lasers this fuller one through the covers for a boundary
shortish length slanting to the leg side as Simmons whips this off the pads
short of a length which rises on Fletcher as he deflects this behind square to the fielder
fuller one wide outside off which Fletcher is late on. Should have done better with that one
defends this solidly on the front foot towards the off side
drives this one hard to mid-off to bring an end to the over
line is a bit too leg side as this is clipped behind to the fine leg boundary
length ball outside off as the batsman presses forward to defend
Simmons has enough as he backs away before lofting McClenaghan down the ground, with this ball getting some steep hang time, but ultimately falling safe just before the rope
length on middle and off which is pushed to short cover

fires in a bouncer which Simmons tries to ramp behind to the third man boundary, but it looks like there was not enough pace on it as this spoons harmlessly to the fielder at point, who probably couldn't believe his luck at how gracefully this one fell to him
raps him on the pads as the New Zealand fielders go up in unison. May have got a bit of an inside-edge there though, as the umpire is not at all interested
punches this back of a length offering to the off side
hits Anderson through the line as this clears mid-off to find the long-off boundary
pushes this back of a length ball to the covers
too full and straight as Fletcher drills this at the non-striker's, with the ball ricocheting down to long-off. The batsman was definitely robbed of two as this looked sublime off the bat

in the zone and Fletcher just hammers this back over the bowler's head to the long-on boundary. Went into the stands as a fella in an orange shirt robs someone who was behind him of a chance to get $100,000 as he goes for the catch, but ends up bobbling it. The guy behind can not believe it as he looked the more favourable of the two to pick up the catch
short of a length and angling away. Fletcher goes for a cut shot but misses
turns this one away to the leg side for an easy single
defended off the back foot to the leg side
pushes this one towards midwicket for a single
ends up defending this one back to the bowler
a bit too leg side as this is played behind to backward square
fuller one which is driven straight to deep midwicket for one
full and on the pads as this is whisked away to square leg
shortish length outside off which Bravo has a stab at, but doesn't get close to it
attempts a slower ball which Bravo is all over as he waits before lofting him over extra-cover for six
once again looking to hit over the covers, but this one angles in as the balls head down the leg side
fires in a bouncer which Bravo chooses to duck under
going down the leg side as Bravo fails to get it away
slower ball which squares up Bravo as this is played down to short third man
tosses a low full toss which is bludgeoned down to long-off
negotiated off the pads to the leg side for a quick single
another low full toss which this time is drilled straight to short cover point
and NMac is into business as he gets Bravo to play down the wrong line, with the ball drifting across to hit the middle and off stump
defends this latest offering carefully behind to backward point
begins with a length ball which is defended back to the bowler
cuts this one away to third man for a single

shortish length just tailing away as it catches the outside edge of Walton's bat to the keeper as he is out for a three-ball duck. That didn't take too long. West Indies in a spot of bother at 67 for 4
and straightaway gets off the mark as he ramps this over the slips to the third man rope
short of a length which is pushed to the covers for a single
defends this one stoically to the off side to bring an end to the over
defended watchfully to the off side by Ramdin
fires one in which strikes Ramdin's front pad as he goes for the reverse sweep. Umpire is not interested as this looked to be pitching outside the line
driven to long on for an easy single
defends this flatter delivery back to the bowler
on the back foot as he clips this to fine leg for one
able to find the gap on the leg side for a brace
nails this short and wide delivery behind point to fine the squarish third man boundary
gets this to angle in from wide of the crease as Fletcher ends up hitting this away behind point to find the third man fence
back of a length which is played with soft hands to the off side as the pair are able to pinch a single
in the slot as Ramdin hits this purposefully to the man at deep extra-cover
defended with soft hands square off the wicket on the off side to pick up a single and end the over
able to steer this one down to deep extra-cover for a brace
once again worked away to the off side for one
thinks about lofting this down the ground, but ends up defending it
a little too short as this is pulled hard to the man at deep midwicket
played back to the bowler, who turns around to have a shy at the stumps, but just misses
full toss which is swept straight to midwicket for a single
thrashes him right away over the inner ring to point
fuller one just around off and middle which is hit straight to long-on
pivots on the hips to this shortish length ball as this is deposited quickly by the man himself
plays thiis one down to long-off for one
full outside off which id driven to long-off for a single
finishes the over off with a short sharp response as this is hit through the line
steps out to this fuller one as it is driven to extra-cover
able to turn this off the pads down the leg side for two
full and wide as Ramdin leans into a drive to deep extra-cover
way too wide outside off as the umpire calls a wide

Ramdin quickly into position as he just smashes this length ball over the rope on midwicket, and succeeds in getting the ball to get past a fellow with an orange shirt who tries in vain to get a hold of it, but the ball clears him comfortably, and goes down one of the stars in the stadium
this time chooses to carve this fuller one over deep extra-cover. The oranga fans are at the boundary, bur unable to get a hand on it before it reaches them, such is the velocity and size of the ball
144 kph, full and going down the leg side as this is clipped down to deep midwicket for a single
146 kph, just slams this back to the bowler, who tries to get a hand on it, but this one just continues through. Guptill and Nathan McCullum both slide but Nathan makes a hash of it
slower leg-cutter which causes issue for the batsman
short and just outside off as Ramdin attempts a ramp to it
short from Neesham as Ramdin is on the back foot to play a lofted pull shot which goes into the crowd at midwicket
plays this one down to long-on as the  batsman complete one, before the non-striker is sent back, looking to get another.
full on the pads which is flicked to deep midwicket for a brace

shortish length which is hit over the covers, with sweeper cover picking up the ball to throw it at the striker's. There  is confusion as Ramdin goes down  to the other end, but Fletcher is guilty of ball watching as he ends up hanging around, with both batsmen now at the non-striker's. Fletcher gestures apologetically to Ramdin, and walks off to the pavilion. Seemed the only way to break this partnership
yorker going down the leg side as Ramdin gets low to club this over midwicket, but the ball continues through to the fine leg rope for a lucky boundary
full just outside off which is hammered to the man at long-off
able to reach out to this wider one to find a single on the off side, and bring up a fifty in the process. Solid innings from the batsman, who's knock has come at a good time for his side
takes a single to the off side
fires in a bouncer which is wided immediately by the umpire
turns this away down to long-on. The pair want two, but the non-striker is sent back, this time with a clear line of communication after the earlier mix-up
clubs this length ball into the gap between a converging deep midwicket and square leg fielder to find the boundary
full and just outside off as Russell fails to get this away

short and wide as Ramdin goes for the ramp, which travels high over to third man, with Anderson making a dive to his right to jump over the boundary and flick the ball into the field of play before falling. Splendid effort that from Anderson
bowls an off-cutter as Ramdin lasers this to the fielder at mid-off
slower ball which surprises Russell as he pulls this away, rather agriculturally, to the leg side for a single
this time tries to club it over the leg side, but this one is angling down the leg side
pulls this short one away to the leg side for a single
